data.title: Ctrl + n works in Terminal but Ctrl + p doesn't
data.body:
In VSCode, if I open a terminal (using Bash) I can go through my history using the cursor up / down key. This can usually also be done with `Ctrl + n` (up) and `Ctrl + p` (down) in a regular terminal. In VSCode these shortcuts are already used for different actions and are therefore not passed to the terminal (`Ctrl +n` opens a new, empty file, while `Ctrl + p` brings up the file selection).

At least so I thought. Turns out that while `Ctrl + n` is configured to open a new file globally, the shortcut is actually passed to the terminal. This, however, does not happen for `Ctrl + p`. I do not see how the default configuration for these keys results in a different terminal behaviour.

- VSCode Version: 1.16
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

data.title: JavaScript formatter doesn't respect html.format.wrapLineLength
Tab groups
data.body:
Hello, 
In my practice I often open many tabs some for one task, some for other, and it's hard to work like this.
In MS Edge browser we have great feature, which allows us to save group of tabs and reopen when needed.
It would be great to have such a feature in VS Code.

data.title: MacOS: Cannot edit files that require root access to edit (EACCESS: permission denied)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. $ code /etc/hosts
2. Make your changes
3. Try to save

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

How I would like it to behave:

1. $ code /etc/hosts
2. Make your changes
3. Try to save
4. Asks for authentication
5. Save successful

I have the same problem with NFS mounted directories etc. In Atom the app asks for my username and password to save, but VS Code just gives this error. Would it be possible to have the Atom's functionality in VS Code as well? Would be superb.

EDIT: Wanted to add that the reason I'd like to have this functionality is that I don't like (and its not recommended) to run VS Code as root. So the result is that any file that needs root access to edit is uneditable with VS Code.

data.title: Problems drag and droping files from vscode to external apps [Windows]
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 64bit

It's possible to drag and drop files from VSCode's file explorer on external Windows apps but depending on the app it doesn't seem to work properly.

Here are some results:

 - droping an image from vscode explorer onto windows explorer: the file is correctly copied in the explorer's directory
 - droping an image from vscode explorer onto Affinity Photo: shows a "forbidden" sign
 - droping an image from vscode explorer onto Paint: shows a "+" but nothing happens when releasing the mouse
 - droping an image from vscode explorer onto a Skype window: shows a "+" but nothing happens
 - droping an image from vscode explorer onto the Skype window's text input: the path to the image is copied
 - droping an image onto a chrome window: shows a "+", but after releasing the mouse does nothing and the url is set to "about:blank"

It seems that vscode uses the object's path when doing drap & drop onto external apps. If the app recognizes it (eg. Windows Explorer), it will open the file. Unfortunately most apps doesn't recognize it.

My suggestion would be to improve vscode so that dragging files onto apps that support it work.

data.title: Load/download extension using extensions.json adjacent to settings.json
data.body:
I think it makes sense to move extensions to extensions.json for following advantages.

- Easy to share and sync
- Workspace specific extensions
- Allow users to create extensions collection which user can enable or disable as collection
e.g csharp collection in extensions.json file will have on csharp related extensions and can be disabled in workspace extensions.json so unnecessary extensions are not loaded

Thx

launch successful

**Actual**

data.title: Decoration types break when removing the first (original) folder from a multi-folder workspace
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Version 1.17.0-insider (1.17.0-insider) ac167c41bababe6c47180012723fa2bc52610ff4
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple extension with the code below:
```javascript
exports.activate = context => {

  const vscode = require('vscode');
  const red = window.createTextEditorDecorationType({
    isWholeLine: true,
    backgroundColor: 'red'
  });
  const green = window.createTextEditorDecorationType({
    isWholeLine: true,
    backgroundColor: 'green'
  });

  window.activeTextEditor.setDecorations(red, [new vscode.Range(0, 1, 0, 100)]);
  window.activeTextEditor.setDecorations(green, [new vscode.Range(1, 1, 1, 100)]);

  context.subscriptions.push({dispose: () => {
    window.activeTextEditor.setDecorations(red, []);
    window.activeTextEditor.setDecorations(green, []);
    red.dispose();
    green.dispose();
  }});
};
```
2. Open a folder, then add another folder to the workspace. Then remove the first (original) folder from the workspace. Decoration types will be broken. See the GIF below:

![vb](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/979966/30203389-5304d35a-94c5-11e7-89c4-53e076560c77.gif)

The issue is only reproduced when removing the first folder in the workspace (in this case the extension is deactivated/activated back).

data.title: Opening links / URLs in Safari happens in old, minimised window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:12:42.401Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

---

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a bunch of Safari windows, minimise the older ones
2. Set up Safari to open links in new tabs, not new windows
3. Open a link from Visual Studio Code. The menu item Help → Report Issues ~work~ has the issue, but many others do as well: open in Github is another notable example.

## Expected:

The url is opened as a new tab in the frontmost window

## Actual result:

The url is opened as a new tab in an old (perhaps the oldest?) window, even if it is minimised

I thought this might be a bug with Safari, but other apps (Tweetbot for example) don't have the same issue.

data.title: Functional style formatter. Color range is all float numb…
data.body:
Fix #32235. 

Per discussion points in #32235

* Color value ranges. Now we only expose float number between 0...1 .
* Color.fromHex, Color.fromHSL are removed from the API.
* Color Insertion. This is not done, but it's not a blocker to the API finalization.

With the new API,

* The title of Color Picker only shows four color format, RGB, HEX, HSL, HSA, which are representatives of RGB color model. When users click on it, we iterate through them.
* When users move the cursor inside the saturation box, we only make updates to the document when mouse up.
* Since we only make changes when the color is finalized (mouse up), we ask the provider for string representative of selected color. We don't flood the extensions of both API call or content change.
* Extensions format the color per Color Format users select in the color picker.

For now, the four formats are good enough as long as we are only targeting RGB color model. If there is other feature request, we need to update both `provideColorRange` and `resolveColor` as the color can no longer be represented as RGB. cc @joaomoreno @jrieken
